result.execSummary:
The defendant James Arthur Willoughby Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 38 ON 11-13-2015 AT 1:30 PM.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.

**Restitution is set at zero.**

No drugs.
No alcohol.
No contact with victim, Martha W.,
- contact may be modified by agent, then no violent contact.
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continue programming.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Arthur Willoughby Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant James Arthur Willoughby in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant James Arthur Willoughby in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO CHARGE: Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to case 2014CM3998), in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS.    

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Martha W., 
   -- contact may be modified by agent, then no violent contact.    
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 38 ON 11-13-2015 AT 1:30 PM. 
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   
Pretrial Incarceration Credit (not received by defense counsel)  mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld
Court modified the no contact order to no violent contact.   mld

Defendant James Arthur Willoughby in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS #2 and #3, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT #1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-27-2015 at 8:30 am.  

Upon the motion of defense, Court modified the no contact order to no violent contact.  All other conditions of bail are continued, including no firearms in possession and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.     mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Defendant James Arthur Willoughby in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-8-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, until further order of the Court.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

ADDRESS INFO for James Arthur Willoughby Jr

Prior: 3215 North 53rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with M.W.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James Arthur Willoughby in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant James Arthur Willoughby in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised that due to a lower pending case this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
